name: Suita conjecture
rephrased: On a Riemann surface with a nontrivial Green function, the Bergman kernel function satisfies a specific inequality involving the derivative of the Green function.
implication_form: If a Riemann surface admits a nontrivial Green function, then its Bergman kernel function is bounded above by a constant times the reciprocal of the derivative of the Green function.
explained: Suita (1972): Let R be a Riemann surface, which admits a nontrivial Green function G_R. Let Ω be a subdomain of R with piecewise smooth boundary. Let ω be a point on the boundary of Ω. Then, for any holomorphic function f defined in a neighborhood of ω, the following inequality holds: |f'(ω)| ≤ (π / G_R(ω)) * ∫∫_Ω |f(z)|^2 dA(z), where dA denotes the area element.
